comments.text:
+James Lourenco beyond a reasonable doubt always applies. The issue with 
this case is the investigation, i.e. collection of requisite evidence, was 
pre-emptively shut down. 

The few instances (and they are an overwhelming minority) of situations 
where a woman or girl has falsely accused a man or boy of rape have not led 
to the conviction of said male. In fact almost none of them have even been 
charged. Women making false rape accusations is tragic, but it is rare, and 
as such is not a sufficient argument that all rapes allegations should not 
be vigorously investigated or pursued because they are probably false.
